actions.desc: The kappa makes two claw attacks.
actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the kappa doesn’t already have another creature grappled.
actions.name: Claw

special_abilities.desc: The kappa can breathe air and water.
special_abilities.name: Amphibious

special_abilities.desc: The kappa can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at full speed when dragging a creature it has grappled.
special_abilities.name: Expert Wrestler

special_abilities.desc:
The kappa has a bowl-like indentation on its head which holds water from the river or lake where it lives. If the kappa’s head bowl is empty, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the bowl is refilled with water. 

Normal movement and combat do not cause water to spill from the bowl, but an opponent can empty the bowl by knocking the kappa prone or by making two successful grapple attacks – one to grab the kappa, and one to tip its head while it is grappled.
special_abilities.name: Head Bowl

special_abilities.desc: The kappa has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.
special_abilities.name: Slippery

special_abilities.desc: The kappa has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.
special_abilities.name: Sure-Footed
